instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 - No green light Help
threads.message:
this unit came in no note, no liquid damage at all

please help :(

all the lines below checked continuity to ground and none found

]ppbus_g3h 12.26

pp3v42_g3h 3.413v

d7005 pin 1 20.37 pin 2 12.26 pin 3 20.18v

PPVIN _S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISN 12.26

PP18V5_DCIN 12.36

PP3V42_G3H 3.42

PP5V_S5 0v

PP3V3_S5 0v

threads.title: 820-4924 - No green light Help
threads.message:
"d7005 pin 1 20.37 pin 2 12.26 pin 3 20.18v
------------------
PP18V5_DCIN 12.36"
Are you sure?
BTW, 20V into MacBook Air, why?
15V is not good enough?
Check the voltage mark on the original charger.

Post SMC_RESET_L level.

threads.title: 820-4924 - No green light Help
threads.message:
d7005 pin 1 20.37 pin 2 12.26 pin 3 20.18v

PP18V5_DCIN  20.43

SMC_RESET_L 3.38

oem charger 85w

820-4924 this is macbook pro :/

threads.title: 820-4924 - No green light Help
threads.message:
STOP using incorrect charger.
It can trigger VD0R sensor and SMC doesn't like that.
Don't you have all Apple series chargers in the shop?

Check diode mode and voltage on the SCL/SDA lines of the battery bus; w/ and w/o battery connected.
Do you get 12MHz at Y5110?
Post its DC voltages, if don't have an o-scope at hand.
